Job Title: Process Technician

Location: Middlefield, OH

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Manufacturing, Other, Production

Description:
Normandy Products Company, a CRH company, is a leading provider of solvent weld PVC pipe fittings and HDPE corrugated pipe fittings, serving the sanitary water and drainage water markets throughout the U.S. from one location in Middlefield, OH. But we’re more than just a manufacturer. We are a trusted and strategic solutions partner to engineers, contractors, distributors, specifiers, and more. As part of the CRH Infrastructure Products business, we’re leading the industry with innovative, sustainable solutions with a safety-first mindset. 
Job Summary 
Ensures maximum uptime of production machines by diagnosing and addressing quality issues and variations from customer specifications due to molding machines, processes, materials, or operator interactions. There will be a $500 Sign-On Bonus after 90 days, and another $500 Sign-On Bonus after 180 days/6 months.  
Responsibilities 
Initiates the start of molding machines and ensures proper functionality to support the on-time completion of production targets Troubleshoots molding machine malfunctions or bottlenecks that can be corrected by material changes or process adjustmentsRecords the details of machine malfunctions and the appropriate adjustments as requiredCommunicates and verifies necessary raw material adjustments to material handlers to improve production efficiency and accuracy Conducts test runs of process or machine adjustments to ensure proper machine functionality and alignment with quality standardsRoutinely changes machine inserts to customize product wording or labeling in accordance with customer specificationsNotifies a Maintenance Technician of a machine electrical, pneumatic or hydraulic issue or problems that may require a fabricated solutionIdentifies parts or machines that need new parts or need to be replaced and notifies the supervisorAssembles new or modified mechanical components or assemblies under the guidance of a technical ManagerPerforms routine analyses and calculations, and recommends changes in equipment, products or test methodsAssists the on-shift supervisor with assigning operators to machines and provides direction to Machine Operator as to machine cycle time and operating multiple machines at a timeAssists Material Handlers with troubleshooting material issuesWrites simple robot programs and makes minor adjustments to complex programsHas basic knowledge of moving different robotsHas the ability to service and maintain End-Of-Arm Tooling (EOAT) 
Requirements 
High School Diploma or EquivalentPrior experience with processing of plastic injection molding machines requiredLock out/tag out authorization provided by companyExperience with basic hand and power toolsFrequent walking, climbing stairs/ladders, standing, bending, stretching, using hands and fingers to hold, grasp, push, and fit itemsAbility to lift up to 40lbsAll work performed indoors in an industrial manufacturing environment, frequently working around hot equipment with exposure to oil, grease, and molten plastic 
Compensation 
The hourly pay rate for this position is $27.00 - $30.00/hr. 
What CRH Offers You 
Highly competitive base payComprehensive medical, dental and disability benefits programsGroup retirement savings programHealth and wellness programsA diverse and inclusive culture that values opportunity for growth, development, and internal promotion 
 About CRH 
CRH has a long and proud heritage. We are a collection of hundreds of family businesses, regional companies and large enterprises that together form the CRH family. CRH operates in a decentralized, diversified structure that allows you to work in a small company environment while having the career opportunities of large international organization. 
If you’re up for a rewarding challenge, we invite you to take the first step and apply today! Once you click apply now, you will be brought to our official employment application. Please complete your online profile and it will be sent to the hiring manager. Our system allows you to view and track your status 24 hours a day. Thank you for your interest! 
Oldcastle Infrastructure, a CRH Company, is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. 
EOE/Vet/Disability

Experience Level (if available): Associate
